description: Explain the conceptual meaning of the terms "numerator" and "denominator".

explanation: Explain the conceptual meaning of the terms "numerator" and "denominator".

misconceptions.feedback: No, that's not correct. The denominator (second number) describes the size of each piece, so it should be the total number of pieces that the whole is divided into. Try again.
misconceptions.name: Switching the definitions of num and denom

worked_examples.html:
What does the denominator of a fraction represent?

  • The total number of parts
  • The number of unselected parts
  • The number of selected parts


Answer: The total number of parts. (The "denominator" specifies the total number of parts in the whole, in order to explain what the size of each part is.)

explanation.html:
The numerator is the number at the "top" of the fraction. It counts ("enumerates") how many pieces the fraction represents.

The denominator is the number at the "bottom" of the fraction. It names ("denominates") what the size of each piece is, based on how many equal parts the "whole" is divided into.
